There can be no doubt about the meaning of the verse in Proverbs, ‘ love refuses to 566 faults': are we to attach the same meaning to the quotation in St. Peter, ‘ Above all things being fervent in your love amongst yourselves‚f0r (ὅτι) love covereth a multitude of sins‚' where it follows a warning to ‘ be sober and watch unto prayer '2 Here love is recommended because it covers (hides) sin. This seems to imply more than the mere shutting the eye of man to sin ε it implies that sin, including the sin of him who loves, at least as much as that of him who is loved,1 is thus cancelled, blotted out even in the sight of God, Cf.
